perturbation.original_text:
1.2
“CRO” means a contract research organization selected by ArTara to assist in the Project as approved by the University and/or Principal
Investigator, such approval not to be unreasonably delayed or withheld.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.2
“CRO” means a clinical resource entity selected by ArTara to assist in the Project. University approval of the CRO is not required.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'CRO' is changed to 'clinical resource entity' and the requirement for University approval is removed, creating a contradiction with later sections that assume University approval is needed. This introduces uncertainty about the CRO's qualifications and oversight.

perturbation.original_text:
3.1 Funding. During the term of the Project in accordance with the Project Plan, ArTara will provide thirty thousand dollars (US $30,000) per year in
funding for the Project, taking into consideration the time spent by University employees required for the Project. The Parties agree to discuss in
good faith potential additional funding required for completion of the Project as applicable and necessary.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 Funding. During the term of the Project in accordance with the Project Plan, ArTara may provide funding for the Project, at its sole discretion. Any additional funding required is not guaranteed and is subject to ArTara's budgetary constraints.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Funding' is altered to change the agreed payment from ArTara to a discretionary amount, effectively changing the funding obligation. This creates an in-text contradiction and can lead to disputes over funding.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1
Program Data and Project Documentation.
(a) Program Data. Access to all original Program Data shall be provided to ArTara and the CRO at University’s facilities in accordance
with the Project Plan for the purposes of review and copying as and only to the extent needed to support ArTara’s efforts to accomplish
the Project. As between ArTara and the University, ownership of all Program Data is hereby retained by the University.
(b) Project Documentation. All Project Documentation shall be owned by ArTara to the extent publishable in accordance with Section 5
herein, except that ownership of any and all Program Data incorporated into Project Documentation shall as between ArTara and the
University remain with the University. University may use all Project Documentation without royalty obligation for patient care and for its
own internal teaching, research, and educational purposes, for publication to the extent permitted under Section 5 herein, and for the
purpose of complying with any federal, state, or local laws or regulations. All medical records that support the Program Data and Project
Documentation shall remain the property of the University.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1
Program Data and Project Documentation.
(a) Program Data. Access to all original Program Data shall be provided to ArTara and the Clinical Resource Entity at University’s facilities in accordance
with the Project Plan for the purposes of review and copying as and only to the extent needed to support ArTara’s efforts to accomplish
the Project. Ownership of all Program Data is hereby transferred to ArTara.
(b) Project Documentation. All Project Documentation shall be owned by ArTara with no restrictions. University's access to the Project Documentation is contingent on ArTara's approval. All medical records that support the Program Data and Project Documentation shall be available only to ArTara.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the definition of ownership rights is changed to transfer full ownership of Program Data and Project Documentation to ArTara. This contradicts the original terms where University retains ownership of Program Data and has usage rights for Project Documentation, potentially leading to disputes over data usage and intellectual property.
